intro: Celsia maroccana, commonly known as the Moroccan celsia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are narrow and gray-green, providing a contrast to the vibrant flowers. Celsia maroccana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and dry landscapes.
